text: Adedamola Richard Kasumu (popularly known as ARK) is a Nigerian politician and member of Lagos State House of Assembly representing Ikeja constituency II. Adedamola has been a member of the State House of Assembly since 2015. == Political career == Adedamola was born on 29 March 1983. 1n 2015, he was elected as a lawmaker representing Ikeja constituency II under All Progressives Congress party (APC) and served as chairman, Lagos State House of Assembly Committee on Youth & Social Development. He's a nephew to Bola Ahmed Tinubu, national leader APC in Nigeria. As a lawmaker, Kasumu became the only first-term lawmaker in the 8th assembly of the state to sponsor two executive bills that were passed into law. The bills were passed into law for the establishment of Lagos State Sports Commission and Lagos State Sports Trust Fund (LSTF). As a legislature of the 8th assembly from Ikeja constituency II, Kasumu facilitated admission of 27 students of Lagos State University and 65 youths into Lagos State Civil Service between 2015–2018. In 2018, he sponsored 100 students for Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board exams into Nigeria universities and polytechnics. In 2016/2017, 2 members of his constituency were sent to the US and Scotland for Leadership Training. == References == Category:Living people Category:Yoruba politicians Category:1983 births Category:Politicians from Lagos
title: Adedamola Richard Kasunmu
